summary: This document is a Twitter post from 2019 by user Ian Madrigal referencing allegations that Donald Trump raped a 13-year-old girl at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan home in 1994. It includes a reply from another user, Doug Scott, and appears to be part of a social media discussion about Epstein and Trump.

persons.name: Ian Madrigal
persons.context: Posts on Twitter about allegations that Donald Trump raped a 13-year-old girl at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan home in 1994, calling for Trump's #MeToo reckoning.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the owner of a Manhattan home where alleged rape by Donald Trump occurred in 1994; described as a billionaire child sex trafficker.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Alleged to have raped a 13-year-old girl at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan home in 1994; described as overdue for a #MeToo reckoning.

persons.name: Doug Scott
persons.context: Replies to Ian Madrigal's tweet; identified as a former USAF Tactical Aircraft Maintenance Specialist and part of the #Resistance movement.

connections.description: Trump is alleged to have been at Epstein's Manhattan home in 1994, where the rape of a 13-year-old girl allegedly occurred.

events.title: Alleged rape at Epstein's home
events.description: Allegations that Donald Trump raped a 13-year-old girl at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan home.

events.title: Twitter discussion about Epstein and Trump
events.description: Social media post by Ian Madrigal brings up allegations against Trump in the context of Epstein being back in the news.

keyFacts: The document references allegations that Donald Trump raped a 13-year-old girl at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan home in 1994.
Jeffrey Epstein is described as a 'billionaire child sex trafficker' who is back in the news in 2019.
The post calls for Donald Trump to face a #MeToo reckoning.
The document is a Twitter post from 2019, indicating public discussion of Epstein-Trump connections at that time.
